content: How can I retrieve all the records from the "Users" table in SQL where the "status" column is set to "active"?

To retrieve all records from the "Users" table where the "status" column is set to "active," you can use a SQL `SELECT` query with a `WHERE` clause. Here is an example of how you can write this query:

```sql
SELECT * FROM Users WHERE status = 'active';
```

This query will select all columns (`*`) from the "Users" table where the "status" column has the value "active". If you only need specific columns, you can replace `*` with the column names you're interested in.
